item.title: About
item.description: I live in San Francisco now, so I do data science in the fog. I moved here from Durham, NC. There I was noodling in the data stream. I’m an immigrant. We adapt or leave. I am trying out blogdown with the hope that it will be easier to write this way: I can do it straight from RStudio with math and R code – should the need come up – treated as first-class citizens.

item.title: I gave up on Anaconda R
item.description: In March of this year I decided to run R and RStudio from inside an Anaconda installation as described here. That experiment is over. Two annoyances cropped up: My Anaconda RStudio wouldn’t shut down a running Shiny app. I reported this in all the obvious places: here, here and here. Evidently, it’s not a big enough problem to be worth anybody’s trouble. That is fine. In retrospect, it wasn’t that big a deal for me either.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.
